chunked_vad.lyrics_text: You know my old car needs washing And the front yard needs a trim And the telephone keeps ringing And the bossman knows I know its him
And the front yard needs a trim And the telephone keeps ringing And the bossman knows I know its him And the bills ain't gonna pay themselves
And the telephone keeps ringing And the bossman knows I know its him And the bills ain't gonna pay themselves No matter anyway
And the bossman knows I know its him And the bills ain't gonna pay themselves No matter anyway Cause I ain't in no hurry today
And the bills ain't gonna pay themselves No matter anyway Cause I ain't in no hurry today There's nothing wrong with an old cane fishing pole
No matter anyway Cause I ain't in no hurry today There's nothing wrong with an old cane fishing pole And the smell of early spring
Cause I ain't in no hurry today There's nothing wrong with an old cane fishing pole And the smell of early spring Sit down in a fold-up easy chair
There's nothing wrong with an old cane fishing pole And the smell of early spring Sit down in a fold-up easy chair On a quiet shady river bank

On a quiet shady river bank Let the world go on without me Wouldn't have it any other way Cause I ain't in no hurry today

Cause I ain't in no hurry today Ain't in no hurry I'd Be a fool now to worry About all those things I can't change

Can wait till tomorrow Cause I ain't in no hurry today When I must return To the cold cold ground
Cause I ain't in no hurry today When I must return To the cold cold ground Have 'em take their time
When I must return To the cold cold ground Have 'em take their time When they lay this sinner down
To the cold cold ground Have 'em take their time When they lay this sinner down Heaven knows that I ain't perfect
Have 'em take their time When they lay this sinner down Heaven knows that I ain't perfect I've raised a little cain
When they lay this sinner down Heaven knows that I ain't perfect I've raised a little cain And I plan to raise a whole lot more
Heaven knows that I ain't perfect I've raised a little cain And I plan to raise a whole lot more Before I hear those angels sing

But I ain't in no hurry Ain't in no hurry Be a fool now to worry About all those things I can't change
